clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of the LiverVision® Semi-automated Liver Volumetry Software
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of Established Manual Versus New Semi-automated Liver Volumetry Software in Patients Undergoing Living Donor Liver Transplantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Royal Free Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.source: Royal Free Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

brief_summary.textblock: The LiverVision® software was designed to provide three-dimensional (3D) visualisation of the liver using Computed Tomography (CT) scans. It provides semi-automated volumetry measurements, vascular structure and territory tools.

detailed_description.textblock:
Liver volumetry has been widely used in liver surgery and living donor liver transplantation to estimate the future liver remnant or the required liver volume for the recipient, respectively.
Liver volumetry is typically performed using CT imaging with specially designed software. Such manual measurements are time consuming and there is an ongoing debate whether the they reflect the actual liver volume when performed by radiologists or surgeons as well as according to the different software currently available in the market.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of the LiverVision® software volumetric measurements
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of the LiverVision® software volumetric measurements assessed by correlation and agreement statistics with the manual volumetric measurements as well as the actual graph weight (reference standard).

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the learning curve of the raters when using LiverVision® software assessed by the time required for the volumetric measurements and the accuracy of the results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Certainty and accuracy of the volumetric measurements.
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of the degree of certainty of the raters with the accuracy of their volumetric measurements.
Comparison of the accuracy among junior, senior, surgeons and radiologists (4 groups)

arm_group.description: This is a group of living liver donors that underwent a CT prior to donating their partial liver to a recipient.

intervention.intervention_name: Liver volumetry of the graft on CT
intervention.description: Preoperative liver volumetry using the CT images of the potential living liver donors.

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive living liver donors that underwent a CT prior to liver donation. The raters will be 6 surgeons and 6 radiologists, both junior and senior.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults (18 years or older)
- Living liver donors.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recipients
